name: Elijah the Prophet
description: Elijah the Prophet was one of the greatest prophets of Israel, known for his fiery zeal for YHWH and his miraculous ministry during the reign of King Ahab. He confronted the prophets of Baal on Mount Carmel, was fed by ravens, raised the dead, and was taken to heaven in a chariot of fire without experiencing death. According to Malachi 4:5-6, Elijah would return before 'the great and dreadful day of the LORD' to turn the hearts of fathers to children. Jewish tradition sees him as the herald of the Messiah, and he appears at every Passover seder and circumcision. Jesus identified John the Baptist as Elijah who was to come.
shortDescription: Fiery prophet who confronted Baal worship and was taken to heaven, destined to return before the Messiah.

weapons.name: The Mantle of Elijah
weapons.description: Prophetic cloak that was passed to Elisha and parted the Jordan River

companions: 7,000 who had not bowed to Baal

quests.name: Confrontation at Mount Carmel
quests.description: Called fire from heaven to consume the sacrifice, proving YHWH as the true God before all Israel

quests.name: The Still Small Voice at Horeb
quests.description: Fled to Mount Horeb/Sinai where God spoke not in wind, earthquake, or fire, but in a still small voice

quests.name: The Drought and Rain
quests.description: Pronounced a drought on Israel for three years, then prayed for rain to return

quests.name: Raising the Widow's Son
quests.description: Raised the son of the widow of Zarephath from death

quests.name: Anointing of Hazael, Jehu, and Elisha
quests.description: Commissioned to anoint kings and his prophetic successor

relationships.fulfillment: John the Baptist (came in spirit and power of Elijah)

malachianProphecy.text: Behold, I will send you Elijah the prophet before the coming of the great and dreadful day of the LORD. And he will turn the hearts of fathers to their children, and the hearts of children to their fathers, lest I come and strike the land with a curse.
malachianProphecy.significance: Final prophecy of the Old Testament, promising Elijah's return as messianic herald
malachianProphecy.fulfillment: Jesus declared John the Baptist was this Elijah (Matthew 11:14; 17:12-13)

transfiguration.event: Appeared with Moses speaking with Jesus on the Mount of Transfiguration
transfiguration.significance: Represented the Prophets (as Moses represented the Law) bearing witness to Christ
transfiguration.witnesses: Peter, James, and John saw the glorified Christ with Elijah and Moses

jewishTradition.passoverSeder: A cup is filled for Elijah and the door opened, awaiting his coming
jewishTradition.circumcision: A chair is set for Elijah at every brit milah ceremony
jewishTradition.messianic_herald: Expected to announce the Messiah and resolve disputed legal questions
jewishTradition.folklore: Numerous stories of Elijah appearing in disguise to help the faithful
jewishTradition.havdalah: Elijah HaNavi sung at the end of Sabbath, praying for his coming

johnTheBaptistConnection.prophecy: Gabriel announced John would come 'in the spirit and power of Elijah' (Luke 1:17)
johnTheBaptistConnection.clothing: John wore camel hair and leather belt like Elijah (2 Kings 1:8; Matthew 3:4)
johnTheBaptistConnection.mission: Both called Israel to repentance and confronted corrupt rulers
johnTheBaptistConnection.location: Both associated with the Jordan River
johnTheBaptistConnection.jesus_declaration: Jesus explicitly identified John as the Elijah who was to come (Matthew 11:14)

mountCarmelContest.location: Mount Carmel, overlooking the Jezreel Valley
mountCarmelContest.opponents: 450 prophets of Baal and 400 prophets of Asherah
mountCarmelContest.challenge: Each side to prepare a sacrifice; the god who answers by fire is the true God
mountCarmelContest.outcome: YHWH sent fire from heaven consuming Elijah's sacrifice, water and all
mountCarmelContest.aftermath: The prophets of Baal were executed; rain returned after 3.5 years

horebEncounter.context: Elijah fled from Jezebel's threat after Mount Carmel victory
horebEncounter.journey: Traveled 40 days and nights to Horeb (Sinai), the mountain of God
horebEncounter.theophany: God was not in the wind, earthquake, or fire, but in the still small voice
horebEncounter.commission: Instructed to anoint Hazael, Jehu, and Elisha
horebEncounter.comfort: Told 7,000 in Israel had not bowed to Baal

translation.location: Near the Jordan River, east of Jericho
translation.manner: Taken to heaven in a chariot of fire and horses of fire, by a whirlwind
translation.witness: Elisha saw it and received the double portion of Elijah's spirit
translation.mantle: Elijah's mantle fell to Elisha who used it to part the Jordan
translation.uniqueness: One of only two people in the Bible who did not die (with Enoch)

listDisplay.secondary: Fiery prophet who confronted Baal worship and was taken to heaven in a chariot of fire
listDisplay.expandedContent: Elijah was one of Israel's greatest prophets, known for calling fire from heaven on Mount Carmel, hearing God in the still small voice, and being taken to heaven without dying. Malachi prophesied his return before the Messiah, fulfilled in John the Baptist.
